title: Customer Satisfaction in the Airline Industry
text:
Business Problem and Analytics Objectives
Janette Limon

title: Customer Satisfaction in the Airline Industry
text:
Business Problem


Airlines face increasing pressure to differentiate themselves in a competitive market.
Customer satisfaction is a complex, multidimensional concept influenced by shifting preferences and expectations.
Our analysis identifies satisfaction drivers and provides actionable insights for United Airlines’ service strategyundefinedundefinedundefined

title: Customer Satisfaction in the Airline Industry
text:
Analytics Objectives


Objective 1: Influence of Inflight Service Quality on Satisfaction.
Objective 2: Impact of Operational Efficiency on Satisfaction.
Objective 3: Role of Demographics and Travel Purpose in Satisfaction.
Objective 4: Comfort & Accessibility Factors’ Influence on Satisfaction.

title: Customer Satisfaction in the Airline Industry
text:
Background

Mission: “Connecting people. Uniting the world.”
Core Values: Safety, Caring, Dependability, Efficiency.
Extensive flight network across 50+ countries.
Leadership in technology and sustainable initiatives.

title: Customer Satisfaction in the Airline Industry
text:
Core Competencies

Global Network & Strategic Partnerships

Founding member of the Star Alliance.
Access to 1,300+ global destinations.
Customer Loyalty & Rewards

Comprehensive MileagePlus program.
Exclusive perks and benefits.

title: Customer Satisfaction in the Airline Industry
text:
Value Propositions


Safety: High standards with continuous safety improvement.
Caring: Welcoming environment with personalized customer service.
Dependability: Reliable services for seamless trip experiences.
Efficiency: Better operations, productivity, and reduced waste.

title: Customer Satisfaction in the Airline Industry
text:
Conclusion

Airlines face pressure to differentiate in a competitive market.
Focused analysis reveals actionable satisfaction drivers.
Strategic insights for enhancing United Airlines’ service strategy.

title: Janette's Marketing Portfolio
text:
My name is Janette Limon, and I’m currently a second-year Master of Science in Digital Marketing (MSDM) student at Cal Poly Pomona. I also earned my bachelor’s degree in Communications with an emphasis in Public Relations from Cal Poly Pomona.
Professionally, I have exclusively worked in the public sector. I previously worked for the U.S. House of Representatives as a Field Representative, supporting various communications-related tasks. Currently, I serve as the Media & Marketing Coordinator at a local nonprofit, where I manage social media across various programs, maintain our website, plan and attend community events, and analyze social media engagement metrics.
Outside of work, I enjoy exploring new places, watching my nephews play baseball, and pursuing hobbies like sewing, reading, and shopping.

title: Janette Limon’s Marketing Portfolio
section: I’m Janette Limon, a second-year MSDM student at Cal Poly Pomona. This site highlights my digital marketing and analytics journey, as well as my final research project on customer satisfaction in the airline industry.

title: Janette's Marketing Portfolio
text:
Digital Marketing & Analytics
Project 1: Sabor a Limon – Website Creation
For my Web Design Project, I created a website for a gourmet cupcake business, “Sabor a Limon.” Initially built with WordPress, I later transitioned to Weebly for better customization. The website (https://saboralimon.weebly.com) allows users to browse and order cupcakes. I learned how to use CMS platforms, embed contact forms, and manage basic HTML. Despite some challenges with image uploads and content layout, the project taught me the balance of technical skills and creative organization in website design.
Project 2: Cal Poly Pomona Farm Store Marketing Proposal
This proposal aimed to increase community engagement and sales through monthly farmers markets and farm-to-table events. Our team proposed strategic partnerships with local vendors and AGRIscapes to create memorable, family-friendly experiences. Key deliverables included a brand report, customer preference analysis, and a plan to build a CRM database for better customer insights.
Project 3: The Role of Social Media in Building Student Community
This research examined how platforms like Instagram and Discord foster a sense of community at Cal Poly Pomona. Through a student survey and MANOVA analysis, we found that Instagram boosted social connection and engagement, while Discord supported academic collaboration. The project highlighted how specific platforms can uniquely support different aspects of student life.
